#+SETUPFILE: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alexpaniman/orgmode-templates/master/lab.org

#+TITLE: Computing Derivatives Numerically
#+AUTHOR: Alex Paniman, B01-108

#+LATEX_HEADER: \geometry{left=3cm,right=2cm,top=2cm,bottom=2cm}
#+LATEX_HEADER: \setcounter{equation}{-1}

* Theory

We are using a set of methods to numerically approximate function derivatives. Here are the methods used for approximations (you can use this list as a transcript of plots shown later):


\begin{align}
f'(x) &= \frac{f(x + h) - f(x)}{h} \\
f'(x) &= \frac{f(x) - f(x - h)}{h} \\
f'(x) &= \frac{f(x + h) - f(x - h)}{2h} \\
f'(x) &= \frac{4}{3} \frac{f(x + h) - f(x  - h)}{2h} - \frac{1}{3} \frac{f(x + 2h) - f(x - 2h)}{4h} \\
f'(x) &= \frac{3}{2} \frac{f(x + h) - f(x - h)}{2h} - \frac{3}{5} \frac{f(x + 2h) - f(x - 2h)}{4h} \notag\\
&\phantom{=+} + \frac{1}{10} \frac{f(x + 3h) - f(x - 3h)}{6h}
\end{align}
